intro: Pyrrheima loddigesii, commonly known as the Loddiges' pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Pyrrheima loddigesii is notable for its historical use in the production of natural insecticides due to the presence of pyrethrin compounds.
